    • Method Detail

      • switchScene

        public void switchScene(java.util.EventObject event,
                        java.lang.String fxml)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This is a function used to switch the current scene in a window. It takes an event as a parameter, which is generated when a user click a button to move to a new screen. It also takes a string which is a location of the fxml file of the new screen. It switches the current window that is open to the new screen and returns nothing
        Parameters:
        event - An event of the current scene.
        fxml - The file location of the next scene.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file of next scene, or any of its dependencies, cannot be found.

      • fadeSwitchScene

        public void fadeSwitchScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent event,
                            java.lang.String fxml)
        This is a function very similar to sceneSwitch, which is used to switch the current scene in a window, but with a transition effect. It takes an event as a parameter, which is generated when a user click a button to move to a new screen. It also takes a string which is a location of the fxml file of the new screen. It switches the current window that is open to the new screen and returns nothing
        Parameters:
        event - An event of the current scene.
        fxml - The file location of the next scene.
